NAEB HEADQUARTERS
1346 Connecticut Avenue, N.W.
Washington, D.C. 20036
TO: ALL RADIO STATION MEMBERS
FROM: Harold E. Hill
RE: Nominations for new Radio Station Division Board
At the recent NAEB Convention in Milwaukee, the membership approved
the amendments to the Constitution and By-Laws providing for a
new organizational structure for the NAEB. Details of the new
structure are contained in the latest Washington Report, now in
the mail to all members. Among other things, tKe new structure
provides for a semi-autonomous Radio Stations Division, with
its own Board (similar to the present Radio Board).
Because the reorganization provides for the election of four new
Division Boards, the nominations recently called for for the
Radio Board from Regions II, IV and VI are invalid, and the
incumbent members of the Radio Board from Regions I, III and V
will have their terms terminated as of December 31, 1963, or as soon
as the new Radio Station Division Board is constituted, if it is
later than December 31.
Therefore, this is a call for nominations to the entire Radio
Station Division Board. There wiTT”T>e six DirectoFs~'one”eTected
from eacIOlAEB Region. In order to constitute the new Board
(which will have regular terms of three years), provision has
been made for initial terms of different lengths, as follows:
Regions II and V One year terms
Regions III and VI Two year terms
Regions I and IV Three year terms
Only the official representative of a member Radio station may
submit a nomination, and he may nominate any regular employee of
a member Radio Station within his Region,
In order to constitute the new Board before January 1, 1964, it
will be necessary to have nominations at Headquarters not later
than December 11. Ballots will then be prepared and mailed out
so that returns can be received by Christmas.
For your convenience, the states comprising each of the regions
are listed on the front of the NAEB Directory of Institutional
Members. Also, for your information, the^'memUers^lTThe present
Board, who are resigning as of December 31, but are eligible for
nomination at this time, are listed on page viii of the Directory.
Please use the attached form to submit your nominations. NOMINA¬
TIONS, TO BE VALID, MUST BE RECEIVED AT WASHINGTON HEADQUARTERS
NO LATER THAN DECEMBER 11, 1963. (May we urge you to send your
nomination by return airmail, and even by telegram if you feel
time might not permit your nomination to reach here before the
deadline.)
